title: Historically, which government came the closest to reflecting the philosophy of John Locke? - Quora

response.answer_text: That of the United States of America, no doubt. The founding fathers found themselves with the unique opportunity to found a nation from scratch in whatever way they saw fit. The Founders were all well read in the political philosophers of the 17th and 18th centuries and used their knowledge to contruct the best government they could. They paid special attention to Locke’s revolutionary idea of limited government in the form of constitutional republic and to Montesquieu’s theory of the separation of powers. To date, the United States is the country most firmly established on Lockean principles.
